text: it's not like being on a fairground ride
so I didn't feel sick in any way and you
don't feel dizzy despite the fact you're
gay grande around in this centrifuge but
what does happen when you climb out
after doing a G's you sort of feel a
little off-balance and it really
surprised me when I first stood up and
then had to walk down the stairs to the
to the seat I was really glad there was
a handrail there because it kind of felt
a little bit wobbly on the feet but then
after about one minute you know you feel
absolutely normal and you can you can
get up and walk away
but it really does bring home the point
that after six months in living in zero
gravity you know it really is going to
take the body a while before you get
your balance right and certainly if I
know for the first sort of six or seven
hours after landing astronauts really
don't feel particularly well because
that whole imbalance you know makes you
feel a little bit sick oh really
